Posts.Content: Oct 14, 2014 02:47PM AndreaR wrote: Hi everyone Mammo and sonogram today and good news.  Radiologist expressed concern.  She said my breasts make her nervous due to distortion from breast reduction surgery 25 years ago.  She came in to do a second ultrasound and wanted me to have an MRI which I can't because I have an implant with metal parts.  She told me to come back in six months instead of a year.  She said she can't find any discernible mass that she can go ahead and stick a needle into.  So I am breathing easy - at least for the next six months. Thanks to everyone who supported me and responded to me on this forum and I wish strength and courage to everyone.
Posts.Title: New here and just need to talk Siren40 AndreaR

Posts.Content: Oct 12, 2014 11:26AM AndreaR wrote: Thank you Melissa for responding to me.  I'm trying to distract, stay calm.
Posts.Title: New here and just need to talk Siren40 AndreaR

Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2014 03:34PM AndreaR wrote: Thanks JoJoy and The Mods for trying to calm my fears.  Last night I was quite anxious and went to take a shower which is a technique I use for self- soothing and when I looked at my breasts in the mirror I noticed a dimpling or puckering on half of my right breast. I'm not sure what the difference is between the two, but there was a huge difference between the appearance of my two breasts especially with my arms raised over my head.  That didn't help allay my fears but I got into the shower regardless and then was able to eventually fall asleep.  My brother's girlfriend is an OB GYN and she said to tell the mammo tech everything when I go in tomorrow which I will.  I survived a suicide attempt seven months ago and this can't be happening.
Posts.Title: New here and just need to talk Siren40 AndreaR

Posts.Content: Oct 12, 2014 08:45AM AndreaR wrote: I have a mammogram scheduled for this Tuesday, 10/14/14, my first in two years.  I went to my GYN recently with pain in my breast and she found thickening and a lump.  I am 53 years old, post menopausal (2 years) and on HRT, and I've never had children. I've always had dense breasts.  I've also been extremely fatigued these last several months.  I am driving myself crazy with anxiety.  Anyone have any thoughts?
Posts.Title: New here and just need to talk Siren40 AndreaR
